title: Pixel 3 - Unable to connect to internet or mobile data after Jan 2020 update
content:
Hello, I have a Pixel 3 that has been working great up until 2 days ago, when the most recent Android 10 update was released: 10.0.0 (QQ1A.200105.003, Jan 2020, TMO/Fi)

The problem is that the phone lost it's ability to connect to internet in any way, both WiFi and mobile data.
These are the ways I have tried to connect to the internet:
1. PC as WiFi hotspot
2. Share internet over PC Bluetooth
3. USB reverse tethering

I have tried the following trouble shooting steps:
1. Restart device
2. Reset internet settings (resets all WiFi, Mobile data, and Bluetooth settings)
3. Factory reset phone
4. Factory flash to Android 10 update in December (Using this method: https://android.gadgethacks.com/how...actory-images-android-using-fastboot-0175277/, and factory image "10.0.0 (QQ1A.191205.008, Dec 2019)")
5. Factory flash to Android 9 from August (Using same method and factory image: "9.0.0 (PQ3A.190801.002, Aug 2019)"

I have not been able to find any threads for this problem specifically, so to me it seems very likely this is just a hardware issue and that I am the unlucky one to experience it :/

I have ordered a replacement phone, but it won't come until next week so I'm wondering if anyone has any other ideas on how to troubleshoot this problem.

Thanks in advance!
